question: Which university did Michael Chih-Hung Wang attend?

content.source_1:
**Breaking News: Renowned Business Scientist Michael Chih-Hung Wang's Academic Roots Traced Back to National Central University**

In a fascinating discovery, our investigative team has uncovered conclusive evidence that Michael Chih-Hung Wang, a prominent Taiwanese business scientist, attended National Central University, a prestigious national research institution in Taoyuan City, Taiwan. According to credible sources, Wang's academic journey began at National Central University, where he laid the foundation for his future success in the field of business science. This revelation sheds new light on the esteemed scientist's early life and education, providing valuable insights into the formative years that shaped his remarkable career. "We are thrilled to confirm that Michael Chih-Hung Wang was indeed a student at National Central University," said Dr. Mei-Ling Wang, Dean of the College of Business at National Central University. "Our institution has a long history of producing talented individuals who go on to make significant contributions to their respective fields, and Michael is an exemplary example of this tradition." A thorough examination of Wang's academic records and publications reveals a strong connection to National Central University. His research papers and articles frequently cite the university's faculty members and resources, indicating a deep-seated connection to the institution. Data from the university's alumni database also corroborates this claim, listing Michael Chih-Hung Wang as a distinguished alumnus of the university. Furthermore, interviews with Wang's former classmates and professors at National Central University have provided firsthand accounts of his time at the university, painting a vivid picture of his academic pursuits and achievements. "Michael was an exceptional student, always demonstrating a keen interest in business and economics," recalled Dr. Ching-Hua Chen, a professor of business administration at National Central University who taught Wang during his time at the university. "His dedication to his studies and his passion for research were evident even back then, and it's no surprise that he has gone on to achieve such great success in his field." With this new evidence, it is clear that Michael Chih-Hung Wang's academic roots are firmly planted at National Central University. This discovery not only sheds light on Wang's personal history but also underscores the university's reputation as a hub for academic excellence and innovation.
content.source_2:
**CAMBRIDGE ALUMNUS MAKES WAVES IN BUSINESS SCIENCE COMMUNITY**

Taipei, Taiwan - In a recent interview, renowned business scientist Michael Chih-Hung Wang credited his alma mater, the University of Cambridge, for laying the foundation of his illustrious career. Wang, who graduated from Cambridge's esteemed Judge Business School in 2005, has been making headlines with his groundbreaking research on organizational behavior and strategic management. His work has been published in top-tier journals and has been cited by scholars worldwide. "I owe a great debt to Cambridge," Wang said in an exclusive interview with our publication. "The university's rigorous academic environment and esteemed faculty helped me develop a strong foundation in business science. The experience not only shaped my research interests but also instilled in me the confidence to tackle complex problems." During his time at Cambridge, Wang was particularly drawn to the works of Professor Nigel Holden, a renowned expert in international business and cross-cultural management. "Professor Holden's lectures were always thought-provoking and challenged us to think beyond the obvious," Wang recalled. "His guidance and mentorship played a significant role in shaping my research agenda." Wang's research has focused on the intersection of organizational behavior and strategic management, with a particular emphasis on the role of leadership in driving innovation. His work has been recognized by the Academy of Management, which awarded him the prestigious William H. Newman Award for outstanding contributions to the field. According to data from the University of Cambridge, Wang is one of the many successful alumni who have gone on to make significant contributions in their respective fields. The university's Judge Business School has a strong track record of producing talented graduates, with over 90% of its alumni securing employment or pursuing further education within six months of graduation. "Michael's achievements are a testament to the quality of education and research opportunities available at Cambridge," said Dr. Christine Wilson, Director of the Judge Business School. "We are proud to count him among our alumni and look forward to seeing the impact of his work in the years to come."
